article_title: Obama's DOJ is bringing its big guns to the Apple e-book appeal
article_text:
Thank you for your interest in licensing Fortune content. Please find information on various licensing contacts below and choose the one that best suits your needs:

1. To license Fortune articles, excerpts, or headlines for republication in various media (including books, eBooks, film, web, newsletters, newspapers, magazines and others), please email syndication@timeinc.com.

2. To license a Fortune cover, order reprint or e-print copies of an article or cover, or license an accolade, please contact PARS International at www.timeincreprints.com.

3. To license text only photocopies of Fortunearticles as print or digital handouts in academic settings, or in academic coursepacks, please contact the Copyright Clearance Center at www.copyright.com

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Philip Elmer-DeWitt

twitter.description:
Here’s a surprise.
The e-book antitrust trial that went so badly against Apple two years ago is headed to an appeals court Monday and there’s a new name on the docket.
Arguing for the U...
twitter.title: Obama’s DOJ is bringing its big guns to the Apple e-book appeal

article_metadata.description: The primary job of the Solicitor General's office is to argue cases before the Supreme Court. Why is it taking Amazon's side on this appeal?
article_metadata.sailthru.title: Obama’s DOJ is bringing its big guns to the Apple e-book appeal
article_metadata.news_keywords: Apple, Amazon, DOJ, Solicitor General, Obama
